citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
On 13 March 2024, the American Badger was found deceased in its primary enclosure and the body located
approximately 3 feet underground. Keeper notes on 11 March 2024 show the animal was not observed that day or the
day prior. Notes on 12 March 2024 indicate the animal was not observed that day either. Necropsy notes indicate dirt was
found in the mouth and the nares bilaterally and cause of death is unknown. Facility notes suspect asphyxiation in tunnel
as cause of death. A facility representative stated that a keeper had filled in tunnels made by the badger with dirt prior to
the animal being found dead, and that the practice was not in accordance with facility policy. The facility representative
also stated that keepers are to report to management when animals are not observed daily, which did not occur on the
first and second day of no observations of the badger. Failure to locate and observe each animal daily may result in
missing and unrecoverable animals or may result in not observing health changes leading to severe harm or injury to
animals. Each exhibitor shall conduct daily observations of all animals to assess their health and well-being. A mechanism
of direct and frequent communication is required so timely and accurate information on problems of animal health,
behavior, and well-being is conveyed to the attending veterinarian.
Correct from this date forward of 29 October 2024.

There was no responsible attendant present when 3 members of the public were in the primary enclosure of 6 domestic
goats in the petting zoo portion of the facility. At time of inspection, the responsible attendant was approximately 30 yards
away from the goat enclosure when 3 young members of the public entered the enclosure. It was not apparent that the
attendant knew the public had entered the enclosure. Failure to have an employee or attendant present during public
contact with animals may result in injury or harm to either animals or the public. A responsible, knowledgeable, and
readily identifiable employee or attendant must be present at all times during periods of public contact. Corrected at time
of inspection.
Correct from this date forward of 29 October 2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
n

narrative:
2.40(b)(3)  Critical
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
On 13 March 2024, the American Badger was found deceased in its primary enclosure and the body located 
approximately 3 feet underground. Keeper notes on 11 March 2024 show the animal was not observed that day or the 
day prior. Notes on 12 March 2024 indicate the animal was not observed that day either. Necropsy notes indicate dirt was 
found in the mouth and the nares bilaterally and cause of death is unknown. Facility notes suspect asphyxiation in tunnel 
as cause of death. A facility representative stated that a keeper had filled in tunnels made by the badger with dirt prior to 
the animal being found dead, and that the practice was not in accordance with facility policy. The facility representative 
also stated that keepers are to report to management when animals are not observed daily, which did not occur on the 
first and second day of no observations of the badger. Failure to locate and observe each animal daily may result in 
missing and unrecoverable animals or may result in not observing health changes leading to severe harm or injury to 
animals. Each exhibitor shall conduct daily observations of all animals to assess their health and well-being. A mechanism 
of direct and frequent communication is required so timely and accurate information on problems of animal health, 
behavior, and well-being is conveyed to the attending veterinarian.  
 
Correct from this date forward of 29 October 2024. 
2.131(d)(2) 
   
Handling of animals. 
There was no responsible attendant present when 3 members of the public were in the primary enclosure of 6 domestic 
goats in the petting zoo portion of the facility. At time of inspection, the responsible attendant was approximately 30 yards 
away from the goat enclosure when 3 young members of the public entered the enclosure. It was not apparent that the 
attendant knew the public had entered the enclosure. Failure to have an employee or attendant present during public 
contact with animals may result in injury or harm to either animals or the public. A responsible, knowledgeable, and 
readily identifiable employee or attendant must be present at all times during periods of public contact. Corrected at time 
of inspection.  
 
Correct from this date forward of 29 October 2024.

This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
